title: Markets rise after US jobs data and despite Chinese uncertainty - as it happened | Business | The Guardian
summary: oil prices fall as us crude stocks increase .
greek poll shows syriza 's lead narrowing .
george magnus : china situation is serious .

text: in athens analysts are saying that the crisis-plagued country could be in for a nasty surprise - one that will further set back the greek economy - when voters are called to cast ballots in the september 20 election .
our correspondent , helena smith reports from the capital : another day , another poll , another sign that greece 's future remains as precarious as ever .
eighteen days before elections and the only thing that is certain is that there is no certainty .
investors , say analysts , have to be prepared for the unpredictable amid mounting evidence that the vote 's outcome is likely to not only be surprising but inconclusive to boot .
opinion surveys revealed to date - and recent days have seen a barrage of them - have failed to break the silence '' of the vast majority of the electorate and therefore can not be taken as read .
this silence in my view is extremely worrying and no one can really see if , and how , it will be expressed in the elections on 20 september , '' opined the political commentator spyros rizopoulos .
the elections may well hide surprises .
but they will be unpleasant . ''
new democracy supporters gather for rally .
vlachos/epa the neo-fascist golden dawn could stand to benefit from a parliament that emerged more fractured than ever .

with the former governing syriza party 's lead over the main opposition conservatives down to a mere one percent ( according to a poll released by alco today ) the possibility of forming a viable government is being put increasingly to question .

this afternoon syriza 's press spokeswoman ( and former government spokeswoman ) olga gerovasilli once again ruled out a coalition government being established with the conservatives , raising fears that a second round of elections may well be necessary to break the deadlock .
that would be catastrophic for the economy and implementation of reforms required to unlock bailout funds in the months ahead .

underlying the disgruntlement in syriza , the party 's youth wing issued an excoriating letter berating the party 's bankruptcy '' and announcing it would not be supporting it following alexis tsipras ' spectacular embrace of creditor demands .
meanwhile another poll shows new democracy pulling ahead : nick malkoutzis ( @ nickmalkoutzis ) gpo poll for mega tv shows new democracy just ahead of syriza .
nd 25.3 % syriza 25 # greece on that note , it 's time to close up for now , so thanks for all your comments .

meanwhile former greek prime minister alexis tsipras is continuing his campaigning via twitter , and linking to his speech at the syriza conference : alexis tsipras ( @ tsipras eu ) we can only stand firm by being united , w/a plan , radical initiatives & consistence .
# greece
some positive news for greece : manos giakoumis ( @ manosgiakoumis ) international passenger traffic at the # athens international airport +17.1 % in aug & +19.9 % in 8-mon .
# greece # economy # tourism @ twitterid

documents.title: european shares end higher
text: investors faced another volatile day on the markets , but after tuesday 's declines , at least europe ended in positive territory .

shares were drifting for much of the day , but traders took heart from a recovery in china after authorities intervened to support the market and help it regain most of its losses earlier in the session .
but later came a boost from - ironically - weaker than expected us jobs and factory data , which added to the idea that perhaps the federal reserve may not raise interest rates this month after all .
( the fed must surely also take into account the recent market turmoil caused by the devaluation of the chinese currency and the growing fears over the outlook for global growth . )
a higher than expected rise in us oil inventories took some of the shine off , sending crude prices lower again , but european markets managed to hold on to at least some of their gains .

the final scores showed : the ftse 100 finished 24.77 points or 0.41 % higher at 6083.31 germany 's dax added 0.32 % to 10,048.05 france 's cac closed up 0.3 % at 4554.92 italy 's ftse mib rose 0.75 % to 21,612.00 spain 's ibex was an exception , ending down 0.55 % at 9938.3 the athens market added 0.8 % to 626.46 on wall street , the dow jones industrial average is currently 111 points or 0.68 % higher .
on oil prices , ig market analyst joshua mahony said further falls looked likely : crude oil prices tumbled as inventories rose for only the second time in six weeks .
this comes at a time when saudi arabia continues to produce more than its opec quota , making it clear that the supply glut dominating the oil market is not over .

with us driving season out the way , demand will certainly wane into the winter months , and with iran bringing increasingly more crude to market , there is a good chance that oil prices could fall once more .
as prices have tumbled in the face of rising stocks , this is being felt keenly by uk mining firms , which has helped pull the ftse lower to erase many of today 's early gains .
us fuel demand set to wane .
patino/corbis
greece is set to miss its 2015 target for asset sales , in what would be a setback for the success of its new bailout deal , according to the head of the privatisation agency .
as part of the terms of its €86bn rescue loan , greece aims to raise €1.4bn from privatisations this year .
but agency head stergios pitsioralas told reuters in an interview that reaching the 2015 figure was unfeasible '' .
the problem revolves around the deal for germany 's fraport and energy firm copelouzos to operate 14 regional airports .
the plan has been agreed but greece may not complete the transaction in time to receive the €1.2bn proceeds by december , pitsiorlas said .
but he added : on the other hand i think it is realistic that we achieve the 2016 targets .
it aims to raise €3.7bn from asset sales next year and €1.3bn in 2017 .

the sales include stakes in its biggest ports , piraeus and thessaloniki although it wants to sell 51 % initially of the latter , rather than the 67 % first mooted , with an option on the remaining 16 % .
thessaloniki .
robertson for the guardian

documents.title: oil prices fall as us crude stocks increase
text: oil prices , which had been moving higher , have gone into reverse after us crude stocks unexpectedly rose last week .
crude inventories climbed by nearly 4.7m barrels , according to the latest figures from the energy information administration .
this was the biggest one week rise since april , and compared with analysts ' expectations of no change .
after earlier moving as high at $ 50.79 a barrel , brent crude slipped 0.63 % to $ 49.25 .
ipek ozkardeskaya ( @ ipekozkardeskay ) # us # crude inventories rose 4.67mn barrels .
# wti declines post- # eia report .
shares have also come off their best levels following the report .
over to greece , and ratings agency fitch says greek depositors are unlikely to have to face a haircut as part of the bank recapitalisation .

fitch says : it is likely the relevant authorities will try to exercise available discretion within the bank recovery and resolution directive ( brrd ) to avoid imposing losses on some creditors of greek banks , particularly depositors discretion may be more limited from 2016 , when the brrd and the ec 's single resolution mechanism come fully into effect , so whatever treatment is applied to greek banks may not establish a precedent for how brrd will be applied in other countries .
greece voted in its brrd legislation on 22 july .
under the €86bn bail-out agreement between greece and its european creditors reached on 14 august , €25bn is earmarked for the banking sector to address recapitalisation and resolution costs .
a €10bn tranche will be disbursed on greece 's request and confirmation of the amount by the bank of greece , the country 's resolution authority .

the balance is to be made available no later than 15 november , subject to completion of an asset quality review and stress test ( aqr ) and implementation of steps to tackle impaired loans and address financial sector reform and governance .
few details about the aqr have been released but it seems likely that every effort will be made to complete it promptly .
we previously estimated that €25bn would be sufficient in a cyprus style '' scenario , provided deferred tax assets of about €20bn remain recognised .
full report here : fitch : greek banks to test brrd 's discretionary powers
here 's more on the dilemma facing the us federal reserve as it decides whether or not to raise interest rates this month .

writing before the latest adp and factory orders data , michael hewson of cmc markets said : while yesterday 's ism manufacturing number was disappointing , there is a concern that it may not have been disappointing enough to prevent a potential increase in the fed funds rate from its 0 % -0.25 % window .

for what it 's worth the prospect of a fed rate rise still remains very much an outlier given the volatility seen in recent days , along with the consistent lack of inflationary pressure , not only in the global economy , but also the us economy , but given some of the current valuations in us equity markets , these remain the most vulnerable to a significant correction .
the us federal reserve .

bleier/afp/getty images what is apparent is that fed policymakers have a wide range of views on what the next policy steps are likely to be and are being deliberately opaque , by trotting out the same lines about data dependence and taking the data on a case by case basis .
against that type of backdrop it is hard to see how they could arrive at the necessary consensus to push rates higher against such a volatile backdrop .

this will of course put each us data release under much sharper focus , but we 're now starting to see the results of the slowdown in the oil and gas sector start to trickle down into the headline numbers for us manufacturing , and this was borne out by yesterday 's disappointing ism report .
another piece of ammunition for those beginning to believe the us federal reserve may not hike interest rates this month after all .
us factory orders in july came in lower than expected , up 0.4 % .
this was lower than the forecast 0.9 % and well below the 2.2 % gain recorded in july .
durable goods orders were revised up from an initial 2 % to 2.2 % .
the rise on wall street has put some life into other markets , which are now showing some reasonable gains after a volatile day so far : markets move higher .

documents.title: wall street opens higher
text: after three days of decline , us shares have recovered some ground in early trading .
the dow jones industrial average is up more than 200 points in the first few minutes , while the s & p 500 is up more than 1 % .

on tuesday the dow closed down 469 points after the latest bad economic news from china prompted fears of a global slowdown , at the same time as the us federal reserve seemed set to raise interest rates at this month 's meeting .
but weaker us economic news - the latest being the adp jobs survey - along with the china downturn has cast doubt on the fed 's timing .
the adp jobs survey may have perked up markets for the moment - on the basis perhaps that it was weaker than expected therefore the us federal reserve may not raise rates this month after all .
but it gives little real guidance for friday 's non-farm payroll numbers , according to ing bank 's rob carnell .

he said : with the adp survey the only remotely accurate us non-farm payrolls directional indicator , the latest release might suggest that there is unlikely to be any significant deviation of friday 's payrolls from the 215,000 figure printed last month .
the adp employment total rose by 190,000 , up from a downward revised 177,000 in july ( previously 185,000 ) .

that said , a 13,000 monthly difference looks insignificant relative to the noise in this series , and a more reasonable description of the figures would be to say that there is no strong directional steer from the adp this month .
one interpretation of this would be that the august payrolls figures will be close to the 215,000 result in july .
but that would be to ignore the scope for occasional but sizeable divergences in these two series .

a better interpretation would be that anything is still possible from friday 's labour report figures , and scope for market surprises in both directions remains , though the probability of this coming from the payrolls figure looks smaller at this stage .
us private sector employment rises in august .
samad/afp/getty images there are , however , other parts of the report that might still inject some market volatility .
the household employment survey in july was quite weak ( +101,000 ) , so we could be looking at some catch up in the region of +300,000 this month .

so long as this is n't totally swallowed up in a surge in the labour force , which was also soft in july ( +69,000 ) , and with some helpful rounding , we might see more than a 0.1 percentage point fall in the unemployment rate , taking it down to 5.1 % ( consensus is for a fall from 5.3 % to 5.2 % ) .
finally , there is the hourly wages data .
we have been looking in vain for a up here for longer than we care to remember , and anecdotes of rising wages seem to be failing to translate into higher official numbers .

but the recent conference board labour data gave cause for some renewed optimism on the wages front , and if this is borne out , then there is just possibly some scope for wages to send a quite confusing message against the back of a non-descript payrolls number .

documents.title: summary : shares inching up despite growth fears
text: round and round we go robertson for the guardian after the roller coaster rides of recent days , the financial markets are slightly more sedate today , despite fresh losses in asia overnight .
wall street is expected to rally around 1 % when trading begins in 30 minutes time , as traders recover their nerve after yesterday 's 2.8 % slide .
today 's us jobs data may have calmed nerves in new york , even though it was a little weaker than expected .
european market have turned positive too , after a day spent fluctuating between gains and losses after tuesday 's rout .
here 's the situation in europe heading into the wall street open : european stock markets , 2pm bst , september 2 2015 reuters china 's slowdown continues to loom over the world economy .
imf chief christine lagarde has expressed hope that beijing achieves an 'orderly ' transition to a mixed economy .
earlier , china 's stock market fell by 0.2 % , despite an attempt to prop up the market before tomorrow 's military parade .
one analysts fear fresh falls when the shanghai stock market reopens , next monday .
another city veteran explains how president president xi jinping is trying to get a tighter grip on the country 's economic reforms .
there 's also plenty of worrying economic data to digest : australia 's growth rate has slowed to just 0.2 % in the last quarter , one of the weakest performances yet .
brazilian industrial output took a dive last month .
eurozone producer prices have dipped , suggesting economic demand remains too weak for comfort .

documents.title: greek poll shows syriza 's lead narrowing
text: financial markets may not be able to ignore greece for long .
the latest poll shows that syriza 's lead has been eroded away , leaving alexis tsipras 's party just narrowly ahead of new democracy .

the election , on september 20 , is looking too close to call : nikos evagelatos ( @ nikosevagelatos ) δημοσκόπηση alco - εκλογές 2015 : στο 0,4 % η διαφορά συριζα - νδ the winner of the election gets a 50-seat bonus ( out of 300 mps ) , but a tight result could mean another coalition government , complicating the implementation of the bailout deal and talks on debt relief .
here 's some context for today 's us jobs data , showing that firms are hiring fewer people than a year ago .
fastft ( @ fastft ) us jobs growth over the last 12 months , according to adp survey .

documents.title: us jobs data released
text: /bloomberg via getty images american companies created slightly fewer jobs than expected in august , adding to the collection of disappointing data this week .
private payroll processor adp reports that 190,000 new employees were hired in august , below the 200,000 that were inked by wall street .
july 's reading has also been revised down , from 185,000 to 177,000 .
that suggests that friday 's non-farm payroll , the main measure of us employment , could be weaker than expected , potentially giving another reason to leave interest rates unchanged .
ipek ozkardeskaya ( @ ipekozkardeskay ) # fed still fancies a sep hike ?
here 's another reason to fret about the global economy : brazil 's industrial output just shrank , and by much more than expected .
brazilian industrial output fell by 1.5 % month-on-month in july , compared to forecasts of a 0.1 % decline .
ross finley ( @ rossfinley ) complete and utter rout .
the worst of a sorry state for global manufacturing data .
beijing could use the four-day closure of the stock market to devise new measures to calm the situation , argues lukman otunuga of fxtm .

the shanghai composite index will be closed on thursday and friday due to the world war ii 70th anniversary commemorations , which will provide the market with some breathing space after receiving continual punishment over the past couple of weeks .
the closure might be used as a period where policymakers in china get together and discuss policy measures that could be taken to stabilize the china markets .

documents.title: george magnus : china situation is serious
text: cyclists ride past the forbidden city in beijing , as china prepares for tomorrow 's military parade hwee young/epa wondering what 's really going on in china , beyond the daily turmoil on the stock market ?
then check out the latest blogpost from city veteran george magnus , who 's been tracking the country rather longer than most .

china 's economy : no collapse , but it 's serious , and so are the politics he argues that china 's economy is not collapsing - yes , factory output has fallen , but there 's still double-digit growth in retail sales and property .
and beijing is n't going to stop supporting the actual economy , even if it does let the shanghai stock market find its own level ( timber ! ! ! ! !
but we should n't be complacent .
as we mentioned in yesterday 's liveblog , china 's service sector is slowing , putting the rebalancing at risk .

that situation will worsen , magnus predicts : as the second half of 2015 unfolds , we should expect the services sector to weaken , largely as the drag from the financial sector ( following the stock market plunge ) permeates the economy .
this could take around 0.5 % off gdp growth .

the contraction in heavy industry , including metals , chemicals , cement , and power generation , may already have tipped some provinces in the north-east and west of china into a 'recession ' , defined as growth below 4-5 % .
manufacturing investment will remain weak not least as a consequence of persistent excess capacity , deflation and debt in the industrial part of the economy .
chinese president xi jinping in beijing today .
zhang/afp/getty images but the root cause of the slowdown , the market mayhem , and the devalued yuan , lies in china 's political system , magnus concludes .
president xi jinping is trying to strengthen the communist party 's grip on the economic levers , and drive through the reform agenda .
there is little question that he and his senior colleagues understand they have to implement deep and meaningful economic reforms to unlock new sources of economic growth and productivity .
the risk , as they know even better , is a loss of control .
and they fear this more than anything .
president xi 's anti-corruption campaign is weeding out high profile party misfits , but simultaneously stifling growth and initiative .

it is also making an example of so called 'tigers ' - top party officials - but it is impossible to go after all the 'flies ' - lower level officials , whose misdemeanours ( or worse ) have a real effect on peoples ' lives .

think only of the recent appalling chemicals explosion in tianjn , where 11 local government and port officials have been accused of negligence and a beach of regulations , so far here 's the full piece : george magnus ( @ georgemagnus1 ) repeat after me : china is n't collapsing ; but sit'n is serious ; and politics of reform are faltering my latest blog

documents.title: lagarde : hope chinese transition is 'orderly '
text: international monetary fund managing director christine lagarde arriving at a press conference in jakarta .
jaffe/afp/getty images the international monetary fund is trying to help china reform its economy and avoid disorder , managing director christine lagarde told reporters in jakarta today .

lagarde ended her two-day trip to indonesia by emphasising the challenge facing beijing , saying : we are certainly talking to the chinese authorities about their transition to a more market-determined economy , to an internationalization of their currency .
it 's a very significant transition , one that hopefully can be managed in an orderly fashion . ''
those discussions include the process of 'internationalising ' the yuan , she added .
( via reuters ) yesterday , lagarde warned that emerging economies should brace for a bumpy ride as china tries to rebalance its economy .
over in karachi , pakistani stockbrokers work the phones as the benchmark kse-100 index dropped 144.11 points or 0.4 % .
tabassum/afp/getty images
investors can take solace that the chinese stock markets are now closed until next week , so beijing can conduct its world war 2 victory parade .

bloomberg business ( @ business ) china 's markets to shut for 113 hours this weekend global sigh of relief but what will happen next week , when the tanks , missiles and jets have been put away and the dignitaries have gone home ?
angus nicholson of ig says here 's a sense of foreboding '' for what the monday session will bring .

the government has made it clear that it will not support the stock market anymore - the recent market intervention was focussed on removing the stock markets as an issue during the grand political spectacle planned for the wwii commemoration on thursday .
once this event passes , there will be no short-term incentive to support the stock markets and we could see the shcomp testing its low of 2850 seen last week .
this would be a further 10 % decline in the index , and possibly even worse than 'black monday . ''
lower oil prices , and cheaper commodities , means eurozone producers received less for their wares in july .
producer prices dropped by 0.1 % month-on-month in july , and were 2.1 % lower than a year ago .
that means that , while the eurozone escaped deflation this summer , there 's little sign of price pressures building up .

eu eurostat ( @ eu eurostat ) euro area industrial producer prices -0.1 % in jul 15 over jun 15 , -2.1 % over jul 14 # eurostat so , might the european central bank be forced into fresh stimulus measures soon ?
it 's next monetary policy meeting is tomorrow , and economists reckon mario draghi may hint at further action .
economist sean richards explains : in many ways the ecb might have hoped for a summer lull to allow its qe program to grow and progress .
if it had known the economic growth position alone then it might have been happy right now .
however it has been in the past the keenest of the major central banks to hit its annual inflation target .
i still recall the previous president jean-claude trichet boasting about an average annual consumer inflation rate of 1.97 % .
in those terms the current one of 0.2 % and no great expectations of much of a rise anytime soon is rather eloquent .
shaun richards ( @ notayesmansecon ) the ecb is beginning to face a qe dilemma
the saudi stock market has fallen over 2 % in early trading , as it feels the knock-on impact of the 2 % drop in the oil price today .
traders are calculating that there could be more of an oil glut than expected , given the weakness of the chinese economy and yesterday 's weaker factory data .
emerging markets are suffering from market volatility today .
msci 's emerging market index , which tracks shares across the region , has fallen by 0.4 % today .
that takes it close to its lowest level since 2009 , having shed 2 % yesterday .

msci emerging markets index since 2010 reuters russia is among the casualties , as reuters reports : russian assets took a knock from oil 's sharp price reversal , with shares down half a percent and the rouble extending tuesday 's 3.8 % fall , its biggest one-day loss in three months .
the currency fell 0.9 % to the dollar .
china 's slowdown is hurting emerging economies across the globe .
they are also suffering capital outflows , as the 'hot money ' which seeped into developing nations from major central banks continues to seep out again .

sebastien barbe , head of emerging currency and debt strategy at credit agricole , sees more turbulence ahead , especially if the federal reserve hikes interest ratesl the chinese problems are not yet solved and the u.s. fed rate hike is still in the pipe , so we do n't expect any meaningful and sustainable rally in emerging markets in the short term . ''
wall street may manage a small rally when trading begins in four hours time , having fallen by almost 3 % yesterday .
fabrizio goria ( @ fgoria ) dow futures and s & p futures up more than 0.45 pct ; nasdaq futures up more than 0.5 pct - rtrs

documents.title: european markets drop again
text: after that early attempt at a rally , europe 's stock markets are now falling back as a new dose of gloom sweeps trading floors .
the ftse 100 has fallen by 30 points to 6029 , down almost 0.5 % .
and germany 's dax has been dragged below the 10,000 point mark again too , down 0.3 % , to 9986 .
the city is nervous after yesterday 's 2.8 % fall on wall street , which was triggered by economic concerns and confusion over when the us federal reserve might raise interest rates .
our old friend glencore is the biggest faller in london yet again , down 5 % , as the commodity trader takes the brunt of concerns over china 's economy .
glencore shares are currently worth just 126p , bad news for anyone bought them at 530p when it floated four years ago .
bp and royal dutch shell are also leading the fallers , reflecting today 's fall in the oil price .
growth across britain 's building firms up , a little , last month , according to a new healthcheck of the sector which bucks the gloomy trend today .
the uk construction pmi rose to 57.3 in august , from 57.1 in july , driven by the fastest rise in commercial work since march .
companies reported a in workload , and new projects , meaning they also hired more staff .
there are also signs that raw material shortages have eased , after recent brick shortages .
housebuilding remains the fastest-growing sector , while civil engineering growth slowed .
uk construction pmi , august 2015
back in london , shares in two retailers have been hit this morning .
halfords tumbled almost 8 % after reporting an 11 % slide in bicycle sales in the last eight weeks , in an unscheduled trading statement .
asos , the online fashion retailer , fell 5 % at the open after it confirmed that founder and ceo nick robertson is stepping down .
asos shares tumble after co-founder nick robertson quits read more
a stock brokerage office in harbin , china 's heilongjiang province , today .

zhang/demotix/corbis michael hewson of cmc markets also reckons that chinese authorities stepped in to push the shanghai market back up from its lows : while we have seen a late recovery in asia , that 's largely been as a result of some late state intervention in chinese markets to help keep a floor under stocks , with the help of the chinese equivalent of the plunge protection team .
beijing 's preparation ahead of thursday 's military parade go beyond just propping up the stock market , incidentally .
officials have even been training monkeys to destroy birds nests , to avoid one being sucked into an engine as china 's military jets fly over tiananmen square tomorrow .
sounds a bit extreme , but apparently it 's cheaper and more efficient than using shotguns and water cannons .
more here : china 's army drafts in troop of monkeys to keep skies clear for victory parade read more

documents.title: chinese stock market falls
text: the shanghai composite index today .
reuters despite a valiant last-ditch attempt by chinese officials , the shanghai stock market has just closed down 0.2 % .
it had initially tumbled by over 4 % at the start of the final session before a four-day break to mark the 70th anniversary of the end of the second world war .
but then , we got one of the now-traditional afternoon rallies , as the institutions known as the 'national team ' bought shares to force the market up again .
angus nicholson of ig explains : the 'national team ' has been busying itself in the stock markets , scaring off any bearish sentiment .
the shanghai composite ( shcomp ) initially opened down 4.4 % , but optimism over the coming two-day holiday and general patriotic sentiment seemed to spur the markets upward .
even that , though , was n't enough to guarantee a rising stock market today , to set the mood for tomorrow 's triumphant military parade .
beijing wo n't be happy .
patrick mcgee ( @ patrickmcgee ) not even close : shanghai -0.2 % at 3,160 .
# threelossesinarow worst .
military .
parade .
ever .
and that left most asian markets in the red again : asian stock markets today reuters
as predicted , european stock markets are pushing higher at the start of trading .
the ftse 100 is up 50 points , or 0.8 % , a small recovery after tuesday 's 3 % tumble .
the other european equities indices are also a little higher .

investors are still anxious about the global economy , though , as mike van dulken of accendo markets reports : after us gdp was revised up last week and china data disappointed yesterday along with canadian gdp , we had aussie gdp miss overnight suggesting knock-on from china slowdown and commodities price declines .
this adds to the muddy over global growth and thus monetary policy direction , notably on the other side of the pond .
the oil price is coming under fresh pressure this morning too , in another sign that investors fear lower demand for energy .
a barrel of us crude oil is now changing hands at $ 44.6 , down almost 2 % , adding to yesterday 's losses .
having surged late last week , the rally in oil appears to be running out of steam .

documents.title: australia 's economy slows sharply
text: markets have already received one piece of bad news today - australia 's economy has faltered .
australian gdp rose by just 0.2 % in the three months to june , just half as much as economists had expected .

that 's down sharply on the 0.9 % growth racked up in the january-march quarter , and is weaker than most of its international rivals : stephen koukoulas ( @ thekouk ) q2 gdp australia 0.2 % cyprus 0.5 % lithuania 0.6 % uk 0.7 % greece , slovakia , estonia 0.8 % czech , poland 0.9 % spain , sweden 1.0 % latvia 1.2 % not as bad as canada , though , which fell into recession yesterday .
but still not great .
although household and government spending rose , exports fell sharply .
having benefitted from china 's economic boom , australia is now feeling the pinch as demand for commodities such as iron ore falls .
more here : jitters as australian economy grows by just 0.2 % in june quarter read more

documents.title: introduction : chinese fears hit markets again
text: a man walks past a panel displaying figures of china stock indexes and hang seng index at the financial central district in hong kong , china , september 2 , 2015 .
siu/reuters good morning .
after tuesday 's chunky selloff , global stock markets remain jittery today as investors fret over the health of china 's economy .
a run of disappointing manufacturing date on tuesday left markets on the back foot , with losses of 2.8 % or worse in tokyo , shanghai , london , frankfurt and new york .
and asian markets are down again today .
japan 's nikkei has lost another 0.39 % , to close at 18,095 points .
china 's shanghai index has been volatile too , currently down around 1 % in afternoon trading - on the last day before a two-day holiday to celebrate japan 's defeat in world war ii .
european markets might scramble into the green when trading begins at 8am bst , but given recent volatility we ca n't guarantee they 'll stay there for long .
caroline hyde ( @ carolinehydetv ) europe # stocks ready for small rebound futures signal gains after worldwide sell-off yesterday .

asia trading remains lower & volatile yesterday 's pmi reports showed that china 's factory sector is shrinking at the fastest pace in three years , while europe and the us were also weaker than expected .

this has given the financial sector another reason to worry , as ian williams of peel hunt explains : the message from manufacturing pmi day across many of the world 's key economies is that , despite the extended period of liquidity support , the sector is displaying less traction than hoped as demand falters in several regions .
those central bankers anxious to normalise policy were not expecting such news ; nor were equity investors .
coming up on the agenda today , we have : 9.30am bst : uk construction pmi for august , showing how britain 's building industry fared last month .

10am bst : the eurozone producer price index for july , indicating whether inflationary pressures are up in europe 1.15pm bst : the us adp employment report for august , which shows how many private sector jobs were created in america last month .
3pm : us factory orders for july , giving another insight into how america 's manufacturing sector is faring .
we 'll be tracking all the action through the day .

bulletin.text: Investors fret about the state of the world economy, as Australia's economy falters and Chinese stocks drop again.
Summary: Shares up despite growth concerns.
Chinese stock market falls despite interventions.
Fears of new turmoil next week.
